text: Géza Varasdi (6 February 1928 – May 2022) was a Hungarian athlete. He mainly competed in the 100 metres. He was a member of the national team of Hungary between 1948 and 1956. Varasdi competed for Hungary at the 1952 Summer Olympics held in Helsinki, Finland where he won the bronze medal. Varasdi died in Melbourne, Australia in May 2022, aged 94.Meghalt Varasdi Géza ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Hungary
title: Géza Varasdi
